data.chText: （叶）柄；（花）梗；（果实的）柄；（植物的）茎，秆
data.enText: a thin stem that supports a leaf, flower or fruit and joins it to another part of the plant or tree; the main stem of a plant

data.chText: 他把那个苹果吃了个干净，连梗都没剩下。
data.enText: He ate the apple, stalk and all.
a long thin structure that supports sth, especially an organ in some animals, and joins it on to another part

data.chText: 螃蟹的眼睛长在肉柄上。
偷偷接近，潜近（猎物或人）
data.enText: to move slowly and quietly towards an animal or a person, in order to kill, catch or harm it or them
The lion was stalking a zebra.

data.chText: 她步行回家时，他偷偷地接近然后下手袭击，并且抢劫了她。
data.enText: He stalked his victim as she walked home, before attacking and robbing her.
to illegally follow and watch sb over a long period of time, in a way that is annoying or frightening

data.chText: 她声称，三年来他一直在盯她的梢。
data.enText: She claimed that he had been stalking her over a period of three years.

data.chText: 怒冲冲地走；趾高气扬地走
data.enText: to walk in an angry or proud way

data.chText: 他一言未发，怒冲冲地走了。
data.enText: He stalked off without a word.

data.chText: 令人厌恶地穿过；威胁地通过
data.enText: to move through a place in an unpleasant or threatening way

data.chText: 这些持枪歹徒凶神恶煞般地打楼里走过，寻找袭击的目标。
data.enText: The gunmen stalked the building, looking for victims.

data.chText: 夜间，这座城市的大街小巷笼罩着恐怖气氛。
data.enText: Fear stalks the streets of the city at night.

tr: the act of following prey stealthily
a hunt for game carried on by following it stealthily or waiting in ambush
a slender or elongated structure that supports a plant or fungus or a plant part or plant organ
material consisting of seed coverings and small pieces of stem or leaves that have been separated from the seeds
go through (an area) in search of prey
follow stealthily or recur constantly and spontaneously to
example: the ghost of her mother haunted her

value.def: The stalk of a flower, leaf, or fruit is the thin part that joins it to the plant or tree.

example.ex: A single pale blue flower grows up from each joint on a long stalk.
example.tran: 一条长长的茎秆的每个节上都会长出一朵浅蓝色的花。

value.def: If you stalk a person or a wild animal, you follow them quietly in order to kill them, catch them, or observe them carefully.

example.ex: He stalks his victims like a hunter after a deer.
example.tran: 他像猎手跟踪鹿一样悄悄跟踪受害人。

value.def: If someone stalks someone else, especially a famous person or a person they used to have a relationship with, they keep following them or contacting them in an annoying and frightening way.

example.ex: Even after their divorce he continued to stalk and threaten her.
example.tran: 即使在离婚后他仍继续纠缠和威胁她。

value.tran: 跟踪骚扰，不断纠缠(名人、分手恋人等)

example.ex: The Home Secretary is considering a new law against stalking.
example.tran: 内务大臣正考虑制定一项针对跟踪骚扰的新法律。

value.def: If you stalk somewhere, you walk there in a stiff, proud, or angry way.

example.ex: If his patience is tried at meetings he has been known to stalk out.
example.tran: 大家都知道如果他在会议上失去耐心，便会愤怒离席。

value.tran: 高视阔步;怒气冲冲地走

value.def: If you say that something bad such as death, fear, or evil stalks a place, you mean it is there.

example.ex: The spectre of neo-fascism, as he put it, was stalking the streets of Sofia and other big cities.
example.tran: 用他的话来说，新法西斯主义的幽灵正在索非亚和其他大城市中游荡。

value.tran: (死亡、恐惧、罪恶等)笼罩，蔓延，肆虐
